history.content: In my experience, either the fee remission will not apply, or your grants will be reduced by the amount of the fee remission (which the fee remission will then cover) -- in other words, you won't lose anything overall, but you won't receive any additional financial aid refund either. However, you may be able to get some of that money by submitting a Cost of Attendance Adjustment request for any relevant costs you incur (such as for a new computer). CoA increases are normally given in additional loans, but in this case you should just get a refund. Talk to your financial aid advisor to make sure. Hope that helps!

children.subject: Allen, but what if my grant amount is far less than my cost of attendance estimate as provided by CalCentral? i.e. grants cover all my tuition but only about half of the cost of attendance. Should I still do the cost of attendance adjustment?

history.content: Does anybody have experience with Berkeley Grants and financial aid? Does fee remission just not apply if my tuition is mostly paid by Pell grants and Berkeley grants?
history.subject: Fee remission + financial aid
